pageContext.claim: The secretary general of NATO, Stoltenberg, is my biggest fan. He said, 'Until President Trump, you had to see the data cost of spending was going like this, and ours was going like this.'‚Äù
pageContext.analysis: Trump made a hand motion to indicate spending had been going down but military spending by NATO members had increased for two years prior to Trump's presidency, in line with a prior agreement for all nations to to spend two percent of gross domestic product on defense spending by 2024.
